title: Enhancing Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills Through Collaborative Argument-Based Learning (CABLE)

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Hybrid classroom environment combining smartphone-based online discussion platforms with weekly offline workshops

learning_goals: Through collaborative argumentation discussions, learners can identify and analyze diverse perspectives arising during mathematical problem-solving processes
By experiencing roles as argument facilitators, perspective presenters, and knowledge integrators within groups, learners improve CABLE performance capabilities
Through project-based assessments, learners can track dynamic changes in argumentation structures and quantitatively evaluate individual learning outcomes

resources: Mobile-compatible discussion platform (e.g., KakaoTalk Open Chat/Naver Band)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
